name: 'Man' Made Locations Trivia Game | Geography | 10 Questions

questions.text: What capital and largest city of a Central American country, stands on the shore of a lake of the same name?
questions.explanation:
Managua.

	The capital of Nicaragua has been rebuilt several times due to earthquake damage. It sits on the Pan-American Highway which ensures good accessibility to the rest of the country.

questions.text: Which town and area of north east Madagascar is now a biosphere preserve?
questions.explanation:
Mananara.

	Located over 300 miles to the north east of the capital, Antananarivo, this area of the country is very remote due to the very poor road infrastructure. It was designated a 'World Biosphere Preserve' in the early 90s because of the unique flora and fauna of the region.

questions.text: Manchester, England is home to one of the world's richest sports clubs. True or false?
questions.explanation:
True.

	Manchester United Football Club is one of the most famous soccer clubs in the world, and with the advent of its own TV station, one of the world's richest too.

questions.text: In which South-East Asian country is the resort town of Manado?
questions.explanation:
Indonesia.

	Manado is the principal city of North Sulawesi Province, Indonesia. Among the area's attractions are dwarf buffalo, and a type of wild boar that has a tusk growing through the roof of its mouth. The region is known as 'the land of the weaving coconut palms'.

questions.text: Which Burmese city was immortalised by Rudyard Kipling?
questions.explanation:
Mandalay.

	Mandalay, in what is now the country of Myanmar, was the subject of Kipling's 'On The Road to Mandalay'.

questions.text: What annual sporting event is linked to the Isle of Man?
questions.explanation:
Motorcycle racing.

	The Isle of Man Grand Prix attracts the best riders from all over the globe.

questions.text: Which small island, near the northeast coast of the United States, was once bought for purportedly the paltry sum of twenty four dollars?
questions.explanation:
Manhattan.

	Now one of the world's most expensive pieces of real estate, Manhattan Island once belonged to the Algonquian tribe.

questions.text: Which northern Italian city  in the province of Lombardy has a Doge's palace with frescos by Andrea Mantegna?
questions.explanation:
Mantua.

	Mandali is in Iraq, Mangla is in Pakistan and Mangareva is an island in French Polynesia.

questions.text: What is the name of the river that flows through Manila, Philippines?
questions.explanation:
Pasig.

	The Magat and Abra Rivers are also in the Philippines, the Rejang River is in Borneo.

questions.text: In which country is the popular resort city of Manzanillo?
questions.explanation:
Mexico.

	Complete with miles of sandy beaches and even an active 13,000 foot volcano, Manzanillo is one of Mexico's favored tourist destinations.
